selected_quotes: Going green: here's how we can easily include 'green' infrastructure in urban development.
How green stormwater infrastructure can be added to urban planning
how to add #green infrastructure to the urban #planning #toolkit
Green infrastructure can easily be added to the #urbanplanning toolkit -
How #greeninfrastructure can be easily added to #urbanplanning toolkit

citation.abstract: Green infrastructure can be delivered relatively easily using existing planning processes. The main obstacle could be psychological: planners are wary of disruption to embedded practices.
citation.title: Here’s how green infrastructure can easily be added to the urban planning toolkit

blogs.title: What is green infrastructure, and how do we include it in urban planning?
blogs.summary: Urban planners tend to be wary of green infrastructure, but changing mindsets could bring environmental and social developments.

author.name: Forum:Blog
author.description: The official blog of the World Economic Forum, better known for the Annual Meeting in Davos, Switzerland.

news.title: Out in the heat: why poorer suburbs are more at risk in warming cities
news.summary: Australian cities are getting hotter. The many reasons for this include urban densification policies, climate change and social trends such as bigger houses and apartment living, which leave less space for gardens and trees.

news.title: What You Need To Know For Election 2016
news.summary: With the election underway it’s time to try to make sense of the policies. To help you navigate the thickets of coverage, The Conversation’s editors have produced this guide to key policy areas.

news.title: When The Heat Is On, We Need City-Wide Plans To Keep Cool
news.summary: The recent spate of heatwaves through eastern Australia has reminded us we’re in an Australian summer.
